var_name_description: The observation number.
The ID associated with the study.
The name of the study.
The effect of an additional year of schooling on logarithmic wage.
The standard error of the main effect.
The t-statistic of the main effect.

var_name_verbose: 95% CI Lower Bound of the Effect
var_name_description: The lower bound of the 95% confidence interval of the main effect.

var_name_verbose: 95% CI Upper Bound of the Effect
var_name_description: The upper bound of the 95% confidence interval of the main effect.
The partial correlation coeffcient corresponding to the effect of additional year of schooling on logarithmic wage.
The standard error of the partial correlation coefficient.
The precision of the partial correlation coefficient.
=1 if the data span a period shorter than a year.
=1 if the data span a period longer than a year (reference category).
=1 if the estimates within the study can be aggregated on a city level.
=1 if the estimates within the study can be aggregated on a subregional level.
=1 if the estimates within the study can be aggregated on a regional level.
=1 if the estimates within the study can be aggregated on a country level.
=1 if the estimates within the study can not be aggregated on a country level or smaller (reference category).
The number of observations associated with the estimate.
The number of regressands in the regression.
The number of degrees of freedom in the regression.
The logarithm of the number of estimates collected from the study.
The average number of years of schooling attained by the subjects.
The average number of years of experience attained by the subjects.
=1 if authors report schooling in years.
=1 if the authors report schooling in levels (e.g., attained college degree) (reference category).
=1 if the dependent variable in the regression is log hourly wage.
=1 if the dependent variable in the regression is log daily or weekly wage.
=1 if the dependent variable in the regression is log monthly wage.
=1 if the dependent variable in the regression is log of mean annual earnings (reference category).
=1 if the study uses micro data.
=1 if the study uses data from a survey.
=1 if the study uses data from a national register (reference category).
=1 if the study uses cross-sectional data.
=1 if the study uses panel data (reference category).
The logarithm of the average year of the study's time span
The percentage of subjects that attained no education (reference category).
The percentage of subjects that attained only primary education.
The percentage of subjects that attained only secondary education.
The percentage of subjects that attained any form of higher education.
The ratio of wage earners to self-employed subjects in the study ( = 1 if wage earner, = 0 if self-employed).
The ratio of self-employed to wage earners subjects in the study ( = 1 if self-employed, = 0 if wage earner) (reference category).
The ratio of male to female subjects in the study ( = 1 if male, = 0 if female).
The ratio of female to male subjects in the study ( = 1 if female, = 0 if male) (reference category).
The ratio of private to public sector workers ( = 1 if private sector worker, = 0 if public).
The ratio of public to private sector workers ( = 1 if public sector worker, = 0 if private) (reference category).
The ratio of Caucasian to non-Caucasian subjects in the study ( = 1 if Caucasian, = 0 if not).
The ratio of non-Caucasian to Caucasian subjects in the study ( = 1 if non-Caucasian, = 0 if Caucasian) (reference category).
The ratio of rural to urban workers ( = 1 if rural worker, = 0 if urban).
The ratio of urban to rural workers ( = 1 if urban worker, = 0 if rural) (reference category).
The country in which the study was conducted.
=1 if the study was conducted in a country with advanced economy. (reference group)
=1 if the study was conducted in the East Asia and Pacific region.
=1 if the study was conducted in the Europe and Central Asia region.
=1 if the study was conducted in the Latin America and Caribbean region.

var_name_verbose: Reg: M. East and N. Af.
var_name_description: =1 if the study was conducted in the Middle East and North Africa region.
=1 if the study was conducted in the South African region.
=1 if the study was conducted in the region of Sub Saharan Africa.
=1 if the study was conducted in a high income country (reference category)
=1 if the study was conducted in a middle income country
=1 if the study was conducted in a low income country
The logarithm of the median expenditure in the country in a given year.
The logarithm of the minimum wage in the country in a given year.
The academic freedom index reported for the country in a given year.
The logarithm of the average age of the subjects.
=1 if the authors use Ordinary least squares.
=1 if the authors use Cohort-type estimation.
=1 if the authors use Fixed-effects estimation.
=1 if the authors use Two-Stage least squares estimation.
=1 if the authors use Two-step estimation (Heckman and Polachek, 1974).
=1 if the authors use Probit estimation.
=1 if the authors use Instrumental variables estimation (reference category).
=1 if the authors include a direct measure of ability in their study.
=1 if the authors use a proxy for ability in their study.
=1 if the authors acknowledge, but do not control for ability in any way in their study.
=1 if the authors do not mention ability anywhere in their study (reference category).
=1 if the authors use parents education as an instrument in the regression.
=1 if the authors use distance to school as an instrument in the regression.
=1 if the authors use another instrument in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for age in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for age in quadratic form in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for experience in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for experience in quadratic form in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for ethnicity in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for health in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for gender in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for marriage in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for occupation of the subjects in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for firm characteristics in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for area type in the regression (e.g., urban, rural).
=1 if the authors control for macroeconomic variables in the regression.
The logarithm of the Journal Citations Report impact factor of the study (as of January 2023; = 0 in case of no publication).
The logarithm of the mean number of Google Scholar citations received per year since the appearance of the study in Google Scholar (as of January 2023).
=1 if the study was published in a journal.
=1 if the study was not published in a journal (reference category).
The logarithm of the number of years between the publication (or issuing) of this study and the publication year of the earlierst published study in the sample.
The effect of an additional year of schooling on logarithmic wage, winsorized.
The standard error of the main effect, winsorized.
The precision of the main effect, winsorized.
The t-statistic of the main effect, winsorized.
=1 if the t-statistic associated with the main effect is significant at 95% confidence level.
